result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:42 AM Defendant Gage A Tallier in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file. Tallier states he called SPD last week and this morning, no attorney yet, asked SPD to notify court as well. Court has not received anything from SPD since 8/23/22 but will continue bond, sets for AIA on 11/9/22 at 10:15 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:13 AM Defendant Gage A Tallier in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file. Gage states that he has kept in contact with SPD, no attorney yet. State asks what the bond is and the conditions. Court responds. Tallier asks about the no contact. State responds. Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 9/21/22 at 10:45 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report

10:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gage A Tallier appeared by video, in custody from FC jail. Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court will have a copy provided to him at the jail. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant understands. Court questions if they have contacted an attorney. Defendant has other cases that Jeff Joy represents him on, has talked to him about this case. Court $1000 cash bond, which will continue and will have set for AIA. Tallier states the no contact with Jenna Piontek and she wrote statement regarding that. Court explains have to talk with Attorney regarding that.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Prior: 1769 Cavour Ave, Wabeno, WI 54566
